link.title: BISD Continuous Learning - FAQs
link.script:
(function(){/*

");}).call(this);

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-OiUrBf jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc
hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: Do you have technology-related questions, please use this form.
Do you have general questions? If so, send them to us via this form.
We will continue to add to this list as FAQs are answered. (Updated 4/27/20)

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto;
span.strong: ATHLETICS & CLUBS:

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.strong: Are BISD-sponsored athletics and clubs canceled?

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

div.jsaction: click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue;touchstart:p6p2H; touchmove:FwuNnf; touchend:yfqBxc(preventMouseEvents=true|preventDefault=true); touchcancel:JMtRjd;focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue;touchstart:p6p2H; touchmove:FwuNnf; touchend:yfqBxc(preventMouseEvents=true|preventDefault=true); touchcancel:JMtRjd;focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

div.p: ALL athletics and activities are canceled during the extended closure.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto;
span.strong: CLASS OF 2020: How does the school closure impact the Class of 2020?

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

div.jsaction: click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue;touchstart:p6p2H; touchmove:FwuNnf; touchend:yfqBxc(preventMouseEvents=true|preventDefault=true); touchcancel:JMtRjd;focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue;touchstart:p6p2H; touchmove:FwuNnf; touchend:yfqBxc(preventMouseEvents=true|preventDefault=true); touchcancel:JMtRjd;focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

div.p: The Class of 2020 has its own page of FAQs. Read them here: https://sites.google.com/bisd303.org/distancelearningfamilies/faqs/faqs-for-the-class-of-2020?authuser=0 .

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto;
span.strong: CONSTRUCTION: Why is construction continuing at BHS?

div.jsaction: click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue;touchstart:p6p2H; touchmove:FwuNnf; touchend:yfqBxc(preventMouseEvents=true|preventDefault=true); touchcancel:JMtRjd;focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue;touchstart:p6p2H; touchmove:FwuNnf; touchend:yfqBxc(preventMouseEvents=true|preventDefault=true); touchcancel:JMtRjd;focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Governor Jay Inslee's STAY AT HOME ORDER went into effective March 25, 2020 at 5:30 p.m. At this time, Washington school districts have been advised by the Office of Superintendent of Public Instruction that Neither the [governors] proclamation nor the list of essential functions would preclude [school districts] from continuing your construction projects at this time.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Based upon this instruction from OSPI, BISD does not object to our contractor and sub-contractors to continue construction operations at BHS. It is vital that construction workers follow the proper social distancing measures put in place by Governor Jay Inslee.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Our construction partners, however, may select to not work during this time and this could inevitably cause some delays.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;
margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto;
span.strong: GRADE LEVEL:

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.strong: Will students have to repeat their grade level?

div.jsaction: click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue;touchstart:p6p2H; touchmove:FwuNnf; touchend:yfqBxc(preventMouseEvents=true|preventDefault=true); touchcancel:JMtRjd;focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue;touchstart:p6p2H; touchmove:FwuNnf; touchend:yfqBxc(preventMouseEvents=true|preventDefault=true); touchcancel:JMtRjd;focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Students will not be retained as a result of the COVID-19 closure.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto;
span.strong: GRADING PRACTICES: How will students be graded during Continuous Learning?

div.jsaction: click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue;touchstart:p6p2H; touchmove:FwuNnf; touchend:yfqBxc(preventMouseEvents=true|preventDefault=true); touchcancel:JMtRjd;focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue;touchstart:p6p2H; touchmove:FwuNnf; touchend:yfqBxc(preventMouseEvents=true|preventDefault=true); touchcancel:JMtRjd;focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: After a great deal of research, BISD has reached a decision on the grading policy for high school credited classes

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.strong: for the remainder of the 2019-20 school year

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: . According to guidelines set last week by the Office of the Superintendent of Public Schools (OSPI),

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;
span.strong: we will adopt the A,B,C, or Incomplete option.

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Due to this recent guidance, we will open Skyward gradebook by Monday, May 4 to provide time to reconfigure gradebooks this week.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.strong: THE KEY POINTS OF OSPIS GUIDELINES:

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Do no harm.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Every student will get an opportunity to improve their grade with their March 17 status as a baseline.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: No student will receive a pass, fail, or no credit grade for any course, except for courses that were already set-up for this prior to the closure (see

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.strong: Student 5

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: example in the next section).

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Teachers will assign grades or assign an incomplete for students who cannot engage in an equitable way.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Students assigned an incomplete for a course will be given opportunities to re-engage in the learning standards based on local school district decisions in consultation with the student/parents/guardians.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: All students will be given an opportunity to engage in continuous learning to maintain or improve their mastery of essential standards.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Every class taken during the closure period will be given a statewide designator on the high school transcript to denote the unique environment in which the course was taken.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.strong: WHAT THIS MEANS FOR BISD 9-12 GRADE STUDENTS:

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.strong: Term 3 dates have been adjusted to January 30 - March 17.

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Term 3 grades will be posted on Wednesday, April 29. Students and parents/guardians may view these grades in Skyward Family Access under

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.strong: Report Cards and School Info.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.strong: Term 4 dates have been adjusted as well.

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: (Grades 9-11: March 18 - June 19; Grade 12: March 18 - June 12) If teachers collected assignments between March 18 - April 10, the due date will be extended OR assignments will be entered as NO COUNT and will not impact grades. Assignments collected

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.strong: after

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: April 13 will be entered into the Term 4 gradebook.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Students and parents will receive communication from teachers about the learning standards that must be met to complete the course and earn a letter grade. Parents - a reminder to check the Skyward Message Center for this information.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: It is important to note that in alignment with OSPIs new guidance,

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.strong: students will not earn grades lower than the grade they had at the closure of school.

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: All students will have the opportunity to earn a higher grade by engaging meaningfully with their coursework. Students will earn a letter grade of A, B, or C for Semester 2 or an Incomplete. Students cannot earn a D or F for Semester 2. See below for examples:

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.strong: Student 1

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: had a B at the closure in Biology and that student works very hard through the closure and through the teachers assessment of the students performance of the essential new learnings, the student receives a B or higher.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.strong: Student 2

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: had a B+ at the closure, but despite engaging with the teacher and the content, struggled with some of the new content and remote essential new learning. That student will still have a B+ at the end of the term.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.strong: Student 3

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: had an A at the closure and could not engage with the coursework at all. The teacher has no way to assess the essential learning with nothing turned in. This student will earn an Incomplete and work with his or her counselor to engage in one of our credit recovery options.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.strong: Student 4

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: had an F at the closure and could not engage with the coursework. This student will earn an Incomplete and work with his or her counselor to engage in one of our credit recovery options.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.strong: Student 5

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: was enrolled as a Teaching Assistant which traditionally is graded as Pass/Fail. That student will remain eligible to earn a P or incomplete grade.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Semester 2 grades will be determined based on the Term 3 and Term 4 grades, noting that students cannot earn a grade lower than the Term 3 posted grade (according to OSPI guidance).

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.strong: SENIORS:

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: BISD has already applied for the authority to waive core graduation requirements for seniors who might be eligible to receive one. Our administrators and counseling staff will be monitoring our seniors closely and reaching out about this as needed. In the meantime, it is incumbent upon us as a district to make a good faith effort to allow those students to earn credits. All of the same grading rules outlined by OSPI and summarized above apply to them as well AND we will exercise the authority to waive credits as needed and as appropriate to ensure all those on track to graduate at the time of the closure can graduate this year.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.strong: MOVING FORWARD:

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: BISD teachers have and will continue to collaborate and connect digitally to implement the essential new learnings and to turn those into engaging learning opportunities offered remotely. They will continue to work across grade-level teams, subject-area teams and departments to consider the alignment of coursework so that our students will be well served from level to level and grade to grade. They will also monitor our students engagement through the end of the school year.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.strong: OTHER GRADE LEVELS:

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: K-6 teachers are working to identify the key learnings in the major content areas and how to report proficiencies in these areas. We will share these with parents as soon as they are identified.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Expectations for 7-8 students were communicated last week. For those students taking high school level courses, they will follow the grading plan for high school students.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto;
span.strong: HEALTH:

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.strong: What are the best practices for staying healthy?

div.jsaction: click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue;touchstart:p6p2H; touchmove:FwuNnf; touchend:yfqBxc(preventMouseEvents=true|preventDefault=true); touchcancel:JMtRjd;focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue;touchstart:p6p2H; touchmove:FwuNnf; touchend:yfqBxc(preventMouseEvents=true|preventDefault=true); touchcancel:JMtRjd;focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: - Wash hands often with soap and water for at least 20 seconds a good rule of thumb: singing Happy Birthday twice takes approximately 20 seconds.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: - Avoid touching eyes, nose, or mouth with unwashed hands.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: - Avoid contact with people who are sick.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: - Stay home while sick and avoid close contact with others.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: - Cover mouth and nose with a tissue when coughing or sneezing, then throw the tissue in the trash and wash hands.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: - Other ways to stay healthy include:- Get plenty of sleep, Exercise regularly, Drink plenty of fluids, Eat nutritious foods, Manage stress levels

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto;
font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.strong: . Is spring break still happening?

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Yes - our current school calendar is still in effect with spring break scheduled for April 6th-10th. We will continue to provide student nutrition services over spring break.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto;
span.strong: LAST DAY OF SCHOOL:

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.strong: When is the last day of school for 2019-20 school year?

div.jsaction: click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue;touchstart:p6p2H; touchmove:FwuNnf; touchend:yfqBxc(preventMouseEvents=true|preventDefault=true); touchcancel:JMtRjd;focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue;touchstart:p6p2H; touchmove:FwuNnf; touchend:yfqBxc(preventMouseEvents=true|preventDefault=true); touchcancel:JMtRjd;focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

div.p: The last day of school for all BISD schools (including Blakely) is Friday, June 19th,

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto;
span.strong: LENGTH OF SCHOOL CLOSURE: How long are schools closed?

div.jsaction: click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue;touchstart:p6p2H; touchmove:FwuNnf; touchend:yfqBxc(preventMouseEvents=true|preventDefault=true); touchcancel:JMtRjd;focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue;touchstart:p6p2H; touchmove:FwuNnf; touchend:yfqBxc(preventMouseEvents=true|preventDefault=true); touchcancel:JMtRjd;focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

div.p: We are following Governor Jay Inslee's orders and school buildings remain closed for the rest of the 2019-20 school year. We will provide Continuous Learning opportunities through June 19.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto;
span.strong: LUNCH: When is lunch served? Where can I learn more information?

div.jsaction: click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue;touchstart:p6p2H; touchmove:FwuNnf; touchend:yfqBxc(preventMouseEvents=true|preventDefault=true); touchcancel:JMtRjd;focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue;touchstart:p6p2H; touchmove:FwuNnf; touchend:yfqBxc(preventMouseEvents=true|preventDefault=true); touchcancel:JMtRjd;focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

div.p: BISD serves Grab & Go meals Mondays - Thursdays between 11 a.m. - 12 :30 p.m. at Ordway. All youth ages 18 and younger may stop by and pick up a bag containing lunch and breakfast for the next day. On Thursdays, youth pick-up Friday's meal along with Thursday's meal. Click here to view the menu for the week.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto;
span.strong: LUNCH FUNDING: The Grab & Go Meals are free or charge, right? Who is paying for this program?

div.jsaction: click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue;touchstart:p6p2H; touchmove:FwuNnf; touchend:yfqBxc(preventMouseEvents=true|preventDefault=true); touchcancel:JMtRjd;focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue;touchstart:p6p2H; touchmove:FwuNnf; touchend:yfqBxc(preventMouseEvents=true|preventDefault=true); touchcancel:JMtRjd;focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

div.p: BISD is operating under a special (national) waiver to the USDA's Summer Food Service Program (SFSP). The SFSP has been around for years and is designed to reach low-income children when school is out.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

div.p: Typically the SFSP is implemented in areas of high poverty (according to the census) or in areas where a high percentage of students qualify for free or reduced priced meals. It has always been a feature of the SFSP to allow anyone 18 or under to participate in the food program. The USDA specifically wishes to avoid stigmatizing low-income children by only having a meal program that highlights their situation. These programs work best and reach the greatest number of children in need when low-income children are not overtly identified while receiving benefits. During the BISD's closure due to COVID-19, the USDA granted a waiver provision to allow states across the nation the ability to implement food service during this time, regardless of the poverty level or the number of students who qualify for free or reduced priced meals.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

div.p: The USDA sets a reimbursement rate per Grab & Go meal with a restriction of one meal per child per day. They will reimburse BISD for the Grab & Go Meals.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;
margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;
margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto;
span.strong: PLAYGROUNDS, TRACKS & FIELDS: Why are the school playgrounds, tracks and fields closed?

div.jsaction: click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue;touchstart:p6p2H; touchmove:FwuNnf; touchend:yfqBxc(preventMouseEvents=true|preventDefault=true); touchcancel:JMtRjd;focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue;touchstart:p6p2H; touchmove:FwuNnf; touchend:yfqBxc(preventMouseEvents=true|preventDefault=true); touchcancel:JMtRjd;focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

div.p: Just like public parks, our outside facilities are closed in an effort to stop the spread of COVID-19.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto;
span.strong: RESOURCES: My child is nervous about COVID-19. Do you have any resources?

div.jsaction: click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue;touchstart:p6p2H; touchmove:FwuNnf; touchend:yfqBxc(preventMouseEvents=true|preventDefault=true); touchcancel:JMtRjd;focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue;touchstart:p6p2H; touchmove:FwuNnf; touchend:yfqBxc(preventMouseEvents=true|preventDefault=true); touchcancel:JMtRjd;focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.strong: Tips for helping your children manage anxiety during this shutdown

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: It makes sense for children to be experiencing anxiety when so much of their normal life has been disrupted. It is important for you to help your child recognize uncomfortable feelings, and coach them in healthy ways to manage them. Here are some suggestions to support you:

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Explain that the purpose of anxiety is to help us protect ourselves.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Teach your child about the virus, and help them understand the powerful actions they can take to protect themselves and other people (hand washing, social distancing). Julia Cook has an excellent childrens book that she has shared to help with this, available here:

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;
span.a: The Yucky Bug by Julia Cook

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Reassure children that for most people, especially young people, the risks from these yucky bugs are very low.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Encourage your children to talk about their feelings, and listen carefully to what they share. Try this

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: exercise to check in, or this

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: to see if there is a best word to describe how you are feeling.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Be very clear that we are all in this together, and no one is to blame if they get sick. Everyone is just trying their best.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: If you are able, think of ways to support the helpers. Letters can be written to health care providers, grocery store workers, any many others who are responding to these events. Signs in windows, donations to food banks or other helping organizations, and checking on neighbors can support us all during these times.

p.style: margin-left: 39px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Physical activity is very helpful during times of anxiety. Find ways that your family enjoys to get moving. In our house we are taking frequent dance breaks and we are creating a playlist of music that makes us want to move. We are also taking long walks in the forest near our house, and doing video yoga. Walk, run, ride, dance and move.

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: had lots of games and ideas for movement, as well as a live recess!

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Find things to do as a family such as board games, movie nights, crafts, read-alouds, gardening.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Let your child take the lead on learning something new (mowing the lawn, cooking a meal, planning a menu, learning a language) and support them in this interest.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Taking care of your own anxiety will help you to be a resource for your child and others.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Balance your own need for information, with your need for self care. Give yourself permission to turn off the news and take a break.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Social distancing is actually physical distancing. Be social, at a distance. Use technology to check in with loved ones, and stay connected to the people who help you feel calm and supported.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Reach out for professional care if you are feeling overwhelmed.

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: is providing youth 13-21 free, confidential, video conferencing and

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: phone support is available 24/7 at 888-910-0416 for adults.

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;
span.a: Crisis counselors are available by text

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: by texting 741741.

p.style: margin-left: 20px; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;
margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

div.p: OSPI has organized a terrific list of resources to help parents facilitate conversations with their children. Read more here: Talking to your children about school closures.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto;
span.strong: SPECIAL EDUCATION:

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.strong: My student has an IEP. How will BISD continue to provide the necessary support?

div.jsaction: click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue;touchstart:p6p2H; touchmove:FwuNnf; touchend:yfqBxc(preventMouseEvents=true|preventDefault=true); touchcancel:JMtRjd;focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue;touchstart:p6p2H; touchmove:FwuNnf; touchend:yfqBxc(preventMouseEvents=true|preventDefault=true); touchcancel:JMtRjd;focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.strong: BISD' plan for Continuous Learning is the foundation for how learning will continue for students during the statewide school closure.

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Special education services and supports will also continue, although services will not be identical to what is stated in the IEP and offered while attending school in the buildings.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: BISD special education staff have been actively engaged in reviewing, planning, collaborating, and preparing for individualized remote learning opportunities for our students based on their special education needs.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.strong: Our goal is to support your student and your family as well as we can under these unique circumstances. We are committed to partnering with families and collaborating to provide special education services and support.

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Members of your students IEP team have, and will continue to reach out via email, phone calls or teleconferencing to discuss and implement a plan for special education services and support.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Additionally, we recognize that Governor Inslees press conference on April 6th created some confusion about a potential opportunity for some students to return to the school building. Following the

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;

a.strong: Guidance for Long Term School Closures published by the Office of the Superintendent of Public Instruction (OSPI)

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: on April 8, we offer these clarifying details:

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.strong: School buildings should only be used for providing direct services to individual students where 1) there is no alternative for the service delivery and the service is both necessary and essential, AND 2) the use of the school building is both necessary and essential.

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: This is expected to be a very rare occurrence. In this respect, BISD began its Continuous Learning Plan this week. Until students have had an opportunity to engage and attempt this continuous learning model, we cannot meet this threshold.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.strong: Any gatherings within school buildings must comply with applicable social distancing directives and health guidelines.

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Districts must continue to monitor and implement guidance from state and local health officials. We must protect the health and safety of our students and BISD staff. If, in the future, BISD determines there is a situation where a student must have an essential and necessary service delivered in person, we will also determine if that service can safely be delivered following social distancing directives and health guidelines.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.strong: BISD will continue to hold IEP and Evaluation meetings via conference calls or teleconferencing.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: As we navigate this unprecedented time, we will continue to refine our approach. The COVID-19 outbreak is unlike anything school districts have experienced and we know there will be much to learn along the way. Our priorities remain the safety, health, and well-being of our students and our staff. The world is a different place than it was a couple of months ago but we remain committed to supporting your student. However, we will

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.strong: need to be flexible and creative with how to accomplish continuous learning during this worldwide crisis.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

div.p: If you have any questions or concerns, please reach out directly to your students case manager or Diane Leonetti, Executive Director of Special Services at dleonetti@bisd303.org.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;
margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto;
span.strong: TESTING: ADVANCED PLACEMENT

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.strong: What happens

span.style: font-family: Roboto;
span.strong: with

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Roboto;
span.strong: Advanced Placement tests at the high school level

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: AP testing will take place in May, online from the students' homes (dates depend upon the subject tested). Make up dates are scheduled in June. Students who have registered to take the test will continue to receive information from the College Board via email, including options about canceling the test if the student chooses. More information on this year's test can be found by visiting the following links:

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.strong: with

span.strong: state standardized testing?

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: State assessments are cancelled statewide for the remainder of the 2020 school year.
